metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5091 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur during WebRTC connections when interacting with the DTMF timers. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.6 and Firefox < 58.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5091` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
